attributes.action: Put up for immediate re-election the parliamentary seat of MPs who abuse their position
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
For any MP who misuses his/her position, either as an MP or as a cabinet member, to have his/her seat put up for immediate re-election.

In the private sector, employees are all subject to dismissal procedures for any disciplinary matters, the same should apply to MPs. 
The ultimate employers of any MP are his/her constituents who should be given the power to dismiss him/her for failing in his/her duties.
'Abuses of position' should include: Any crime committed under UK criminal or civil law;
Falsehoods or omissions from the register of Member's interests; Employment of partner/spouse or family members in consituency office without independently proven justification; Falsification or inflation of expense claims; Any act proven not to be in the best interests of his/her constituents.

This is by no means an exhaustive list of potential abuses of power which should be included but hopefully provides a reasonable guideline for a more detailed list, dictated by common sense and decency.
